visualization_prompt: Generate a polar chart showing seasonal temperature fluctuations using a sinusoidal synthetic data model with bimodal peaks
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains 12 monthly observations (categorical ordinal scale) with synthetic temperature values (quantitative ratio scale). Data was generated using a sinusoidal model (μ=100°F, amplitude=50°F) with intentional phase shift to create bimodal peaks in April and October, simulating seasonal patterns. The polar chart format emphasizes cyclical temporal relationships while respecting Tufte's data-ink ratio through clean radial gridlines and minimal tick marks. Cairo's perceptual principles are applied through angular position encoding (months) and radial distance encoding (temperature), leveraging human capacity for polar coordinate interpretation. The non-connected ends prevent false cyclical continuity perception, while the dual-peak pattern (Q2 and Q4 maxima) demonstrates intentional cluster generation in synthetic data.
